title: WCAGAI Light Charter
description: Machine-readable ethical principles embedded into WCAGAI architecture

rules: All AI responses must indicate confidence levels
Uncertain information must be explicitly flagged
Never present speculation as fact
Provide sources when making factual claims

accessibility_first.description: WCAG AA minimum, disabled users as first-class
rules: All generated content must meet WCAG 2.1 Level AA
Disabled users are not edge cases
Alternative text must be meaningful, not decorative
Color cannot be the only means of conveying information
Keyboard navigation must be fully supported

trauma_informed.description: Language avoids shaming, coerced consent, retraumatization
rules: Avoid language that shames or blames users
Never coerce consent or use manipulative language
Be mindful of trauma triggers in content
Provide content warnings for potentially triggering material
Respect user boundaries and autonomy

autonomy_respect.description: No dark patterns, no manipulative nudging
rules: No hidden costs or fees
Clear, honest communication about consequences
Easy opt-out mechanisms for all features
No forced continuity or auto-renewal without clear disclosure
Respect user decisions without punishment
All AI model calls must be logged with context
Every decision must have an audit trail
Explanations must be provided for all recommendations
Users can request reasoning for any output
Data retention policies must be documented

intersectionality.description: Marginalized users centered, not as afterthought
rules: Consider multiple intersecting identities
Marginalized users inform design from the start
Test with diverse user groups
Avoid assumptions about user capabilities or background
Ensure cultural sensitivity in all content
